structure.name: Parser
structure.declaration: /** * ICalParserLineGenFunc: * @bytes: (array length=size) (element-type gchar): the bytes to process * @size: the length of the bytes array * @user_data: the user data * * Returns: One content line per invocation */ typedef gchar *(*ICalParserLineGenFunc)(gchar *bytes, size_t size, gpointer user_data);

method.name: i_cal_parser_add_line

parameter.name: parser
parameter.comment: The #ICalParser used to parse the string into the #ICalComponent

parameter.name: str
parameter.comment: A line of string representation of the #ICalComponent

method.comment: Add a line at one time into the #ICalParser until the parsing is complete and #ICalComponent will be returned.

method.name: i_cal_parser_clean

parameter.name: parser
parameter.comment: The parser to be cleaned and queried

method.comment: We won't get a clean exit if some components did not have an "END" tag. Clear off any component that may be left in the list.

method.name: i_cal_parser_get_state

returns.comment: The parser state stored in the #ICalParser.

method.comment: Gets the state of the target parser.

method.name: i_cal_parser_parse

parameter.name: parser
parameter.comment: The parser used to parse the string and output the #ICalComponent

returns.comment: The component output by the parser.

method.comment: icalparser_parse takes a string that holds the text ( in RFC 2445 format ) and returns a pointer to an #ICalComponent. The caller owns the memory. @func is a pointer to a function that returns one content line per invocation.

method.name: i_cal_parser_get_line
method.comment: Given a line generator function, returns a single iCal content line.
